snippet: Sergei Udaltsov, leader of the radical socialist Left Front movement, faces a charge of conspiracy to incite mass disorder and faces up to 10 years in prison.
abstract: Russian court orders prominent opposition leader Sergei Udaltsov to be placed under house arrests, in one of most assertive legal measures to date against leader of anti-Kremlin protest that began more than one year before.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROTH and ELLEN BARRY

lead_paragraph: Sergei Udaltsov, leader of the radical socialist Left Front movement, faces a charge of conspiracy to incite mass disorder and faces up to 10 years in prison.

headline.seo: Russian Protest Leader Is Put Under House Arrest
headline.main: Russian Protest Leader Put Under House Arrest
headline.print_headline: Russian Court Confines Protest Leader to Home
